snippet: France shoved aside months of international hesitation about storming the region after every other effort by the United States and its allies to thwart the extremists had failed.
abstract: French fighter jets strike deep inside Islamist strongholds in northern Mali, shoving aside months of international hesitation about storming the region and physically acknowledging that every other effort by United States and its allies to thwart the extremists had failed; France's offensive goes in face of longstanding American warnings that Western assault could rally jihadists around the world and prompt terrorist attacks as far away as Europe.

byline.original: By ADAM NOSSITER, ERIC SCHMITT and MARK MAZZETTI
byline.contributor: Adam Nossiter reported from Bamako, Eric Schmitt from Niamey, Niger, and from Washington, and Mark Mazzetti from Washington. Steven Erlanger contributed reporting from Paris.

lead_paragraph: France shoved aside months of international hesitation about storming the region after every other effort by the United States and its allies to thwart the extremists had failed.

headline.seo: French Jets Strike Deep Inside Islamist-Held Mali
headline.main: French Strikes in Mali Supplant Caution of U.S.
headline.print_headline: French Strikes In Mali Supplant Caution Of U.S.
